net.openhft.chronicle.bytes

Interface Bytes<Underlying>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, BytesStore<Bytes<Underlying>,Underlying>, ByteStringAppender<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, ByteStringParser<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, CharSequence, Closeable, RandomCommon<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, RandomDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, RandomDataOutput<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, net.openhft.chronicle.core.ReferenceCounted, StreamingCommon<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, StreamingDataOutput<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBytes, BytesStoreBytes, MappedBytes, NativeBytes, ZeroedBytes

extends BytesStore<Bytes<Underlying>,Underlying>, StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, StreamingDataOutput<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, ByteStringParser<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, ByteStringAppender<Bytes<Underlying>,Access<Underlying>,Underlying>, CharSequence

      • mark

        @Deprecated
Bytes mark()
        Deprecated. Don't use mark() or reset(), use a lambda method like withLength
        Sets this buffer's mark at its position.
        Returns:
        This buffer

      • reset

        @Deprecated
Bytes reset()
                 throws InvalidMarkException
        Deprecated. Don't use mark() or reset(), use a lambda method like withLength
        Resets this buffer's position to the previously-marked position. Invoking this method neither changes nor discards the mark's value.
        Returns:
        This buffer
        Throws:
        InvalidMarkException - If the mark has not been set

      • ensureCapacity

        default void ensureCapacity(long size)
        grow the buffer if the buffer is elastic, if the buffer is not elastic and there is not enough capacity then this method will throws BufferOverflowException
        Parameters:
        size - the capacity that you required
        Throws:
        BufferOverflowException - if the buffer is not elastic and there is not enough space

                    Bytes buffer)
        display the hex data of Bytes from the position() to the limit()
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        hex representation of the buffer, from example [0D ,OA, FF]
